greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Permutation of natural numbers: a(n) = A246275(A055396(n+1), A078898(n+1)).
comment: a(n) tells which number in square array A246275 is at the same position where n is in array A249741, the sieve of Eratosthenes minus 1. As the topmost row in both arrays is A005408 (odd numbers), they are fixed, i.e. a(2n+1) = 2n+1 for all n. Also, as the leftmost column in both arrays is primes minus one (A006093), they are also among the fixed points.
Equally: a(n) tells which number in array A246273 is at the same position where n is in the array A114881, as they are the transposes of above two arrays.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
formula: As a composition of other permutations:
a(A005408(n-1)) = A005408(n-1) and a(A006093(n)) = A006093(n). [Fixes odd numbers and precedents of primes. Cf. comments above].
xref: Similar or related permutations: A250243 ("deep variant"), A246676, A249812, A249818, A246273, A246275, A114881, A249741.
Differs from A249815 and A250244 for the first time at n=32, where a(32) = 44, while A249815(32) = A250244(32) = 38.
Differs from A250244 for the first time at n=39, where a(39) = 39, while A250243(39) = 51.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Nov 06 2014
